domino_project

Class CardinalGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • domino_project.MultiplayerGame
      • domino_project.CardinalGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CardinalGame
extends MultiplayerGame
    This class represents the Cardinal Type of Domino Game.Its a MultiplayerGame played with a user and Bot(s)(1 or more).The player with the highest double tile starts playing first.The rule is that the touching sides of the tiles put on line have total sum of 7.The double blanks([0,0]) and the tiles with sum=7(e.g. [4,3],[6,1]) are considered baladers.They can be put anywhere reversed or not.Next to a 0 can only be put a balader.The players autommatically draw a tile from stack when they can't put any tile on Line UNTIL THEY CAN.The user can draw as many tiles as they want independently from being able to play or not. The first tile to be put on Line can be anyone.If noone has a double then User plays first.Players' turn ends when they put a tile on Line.If someone can't put a tile and also can't draw a tile from stack then the next one makes a move.If more than 1 players have the same points at the end of the round they all share the same points.

    • Method Detail

      • game

        public void game()
        This method represents the main game loop for Cardinal Type of DominoGame.Combines all the methods in a main loop and show the winner at the end.

      • roundloop

        public void roundloop()
        This method represents the main round loop.The players get in an order.The player with the highest double Tile starts putting tiles on Line until they cannot put anymore and then plays the other. If nobody can put any tiles(done=false) on line, we get a new round.

      • handlePointsOfWinner

        protected void handlePointsOfWinner()
        Points are handled to the winner of the round. The one with the less points on their hand collects their opponents' points. If for example, 2 players have the same points each of them gets the same points from their opponents.
        Specified by:
        handlePointsOfWinner in class MultiplayerGame

      • isPlayerAbleToPlay

        protected boolean isPlayerAbleToPlay(Player p)
        Description copied from class: MultiplayerGame
        Checks if Player p is able to put a tile on Line. If they have no tiles on hand returns false.
        Overrides:
        isPlayerAbleToPlay in class MultiplayerGame
        Parameters:

        Returns:
